instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.SMBUS_BATT_SCL: What is SMBUS_BATT_SCL? SMBUS_BATT_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_BATT_SDA: What is SMBUS_BATT_SDA? SMBUS_BATT_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
I have this board that's not recognizing the battery but once i power on the computer with a magsafe, i can then run the system without the magsafe. On the display, it's not showing the battery.

I've replaced the SMC and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. I've also check check <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/2, and <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Remove <DIODE>D7050</DIODE>, if present...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message: Check what it says about the battery under System Profiler.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message: Try another battery first, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SCL</SIGNAL> - 0.649(1.66v steady). Same readings with <DIODE>D7050</DIODE>
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SDA</SIGNAL> - 0.55/(Voltage reading bounces between 3.4 and .22). With <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> removed, it does the same thing on voltage reading and has same diode reading. 
This is interesting because before the SMC replacement, both voltages, though the were low (not 3.4), they were steady and not bouncing about. I did have a very low resistance measurement at the time, in the ohms level and not the 11kohm level that i'm at now. Wondering if this smc is defective as well. Before i go buying another set of donor boards, is there anything else i should check?

Battery profile so "no" for battery connected.

And i did try with a new battery also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Diode mode on these lines must be very similar, less than 1% difference.
Did you check that before changing SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message: Unfortunately i didn't check the diode readings after i had got very low ohm resistance measurement on both lines. I proceeded to Pulled the smc to check for crap that may be underneath and then noticed resistance went up into the Kohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message: You should check these values without SMC, once out of board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
with SMC removed, 

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SCL</SIGNAL> - 0.65
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SDA</SIGNAL> - 0.55

I checked resistors <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and 5381, both are good at 2K.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Too big difference; hope you checked both lines when board got cold.
Remove <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and check again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
You've saved the day again. So it appears the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> chip (which was a new chip and not from a donor board) that i had replaced earlier was also defective. Now both lines are reading 0.55 and the board now recognizes the battery.

Thanks again for the assist.
